metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22720 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier fails to close inbound connection when errors are encountered discarding the request body, exposing the server to HTTP Request Smuggling

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.52-1ubuntu2
apache2-bin - 2.4.52-1ubuntu2
apache2-data - 2.4.52-1ubuntu2
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.52-1ubuntu2
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.52-1ubuntu2
apache2-utils - 2.4.52-1ubuntu2
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.52-1ubuntu2
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.52-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.52-1ubuntu2').
